byline.contributor: David Callender and Ashley Southall contributed reporting.

abstract: Ismael Ozanne, district attorney for Dane County, Wis, says Madison Police Officer Matt Kenny will not face criminal charges in shooting death of Anthony Robinson Jr in March 2015; case raised possibility of unrest as Robinson was black and unarmed and Kenny is white; Ozanne says in press conference shooting was justified due to Robinson's erratic behavior and because he had assaulted several people, including Officer Kenny.
lead_paragraph: The district attorney in Madison said the shooting of Anthony Robinson Jr., 19, was provoked by erratic behavior that included the assaults.

headline.main: No Charges for Wisconsin Officer in Killing of Unarmed Black Teenager
headline.print_headline: No Charges for Wisconsin Officer in Black Man’s Death

snippet: The district attorney in Madison said the shooting of Anthony Robinson Jr., 19, was provoked by erratic behavior that included the assaults.
